chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Shane R Beaudette was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating w/ PAC (6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to sentences currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes: Pay fine, costs, DNA surcharges. 25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety also during Extended Supervision.
- Complete and Alcohol/Drug Assessment and comply with recommendations and aftercare treatment.
- Comply with any other counseling, reasonably related, as recommended by the Agent.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Shane R Beaudette in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Defendant Shane R Beaudette in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: No Contest Ct 1.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Ct 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. Count 2 is DRI

ADA Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Sheets concurs with joint agreement and request Substance Abuse Program. 

BY THE COURT:
Prison at 1 yr Incarceration and 2 yrs Extended Supervision, consecutive sentences currently serving. Eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
$600 Fine  + Cost + DNA Surcharge $250 = $1,769.00
$26.45 Blood Draw Fee
36 months Revocation of License
36 months Ignition Interlock Device
Order for DOT Alcohol Assessment/Driver's Safety Plan .04%

ES Conditions:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety also during Extended Supervision.
- Obtain/maintain full-time employment.
- Complete and Alcohol/Drug Assessment and comply with recommendations and aftercare treatment.
- Comply with any other counseling, reasonably related, as recommended by the Agent.

Court informs of Felons can't possess a firearm.
Court informs of not able to vote until being restored.
Appeal rights are given.
and Writ of Habeas

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-08-2016 01:30 pm
Pre-trial conference at 11-16-2015 09:30 am

Defendant Shane R Beaudette in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Defendant Shane R Beaudette in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Set for Motion Hearing to Reconsider filed by the State.

11:07 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearance for the State.
Atty Sheets states his appearance.
Atty Cousins refers to his brief in regards to a collateral attack and makes statements regarding this issue.
Atty Cousins states that there was a hearing in front of Judge Wright and that due to the fact that the collateral attack had been stipulated to
in the 2011 Chippewa County case that it should also be granted in this case and that is what occurred on September 10, 2015.
Atty Sheets makes his argument regarding the motion filed by the State.
Atty Sheets is asking the Court to Affirm the decision of Judge Wright.
11:16 a.m.  Atty Cousins makes statements to the response of Atty Sheets.
Atty Cousins indicates that he can file an amended information and that a pretrial is set.
Atty Sheets will request another pretrial.

BY THE COURT:
Motion is DENIED for the State.
Motion for the defense is GRANTED.

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 09:30 am.
and Writ of Habeas Corpus

Set for Motion Hearing regarding Collaterally Attacking Defendant's Prior Drunk Driving Convictions.

2:09 p.m.  Court calls case.

Defendant Shane R Beaudette in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Defendant Shane R Beaudette in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:27 P.M.   Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

PRELIMINARY HEARING:
3:28 p.m.  State Patrol Officer Cary Cisewski is sworn in.
Exhibit #1 is marked for Atty Cousins.
Direct examination by Atty Cousins.
Witness identifies the defendant; so noted by the Court.
3:31 p.m.  Exhibit #1 is referenced by Atty Cousins.
Atty Cousins moves Exhibit #1 into evidence; no objection by Atty Sheets.  Received by the Court.
3:32 p.m.  Cross examination by Atty Sheets.
3:35 p.m.  No re-direct by Atty Cousins.
Witness is excused.
Atty Sheet's makes statements on the record but is not for today's hearing.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.

ARRAIGNMENT:
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

BY THE COURT:
NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Preliminary hearing on March 2, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Shane R Beaudette appeared by video. Attorney Eric Sheets in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

BY THE COURT:  Bond Continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
If bond posted then required to participate in the Pre-Trial Supervision Program.

Clerk is Shelley P.
11:22 a.m.  ADA Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Cousins  states facts for anticipated charges of Operating with a PAC (7th or 8th) and Operating while Revoked.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $5,000.00 cash bond with conditions as stated.
Defendant is remanded to the custody of the Portage County Sheriff's Department.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  February 23, 2015 @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2
